MS MCQs

    Manage your Azure IoT Hub with alerts and metrics - Summary

    »

    1. In the lists of metrics, what does the acronym C2D stand for?

      Cloud to Data

      Cloud to Device

      Cost to Device

      Cost to Data


    2. Over a period of time, a metric has the following 10 values: 6, 4, 5, 0, 12, -1, -2, 0, 4, 2. What are the Avg, Min, Max, and Sum of these metrics?

      Avg = 3.3, Min = -2, Max = 12, Sum = 33

      Avg = 3, Min = -2, Max = 12, Sum = 30

      Avg = 3, Min = 0, Max = 12, Sum = 30

      Avg = 2.5, Min = -1, Max = 6, Sum = 25


    3. Which of these tools is not an Action Type?

      Automation Runbook

      Email Azure Resource Manager Role

      Secure Webhook

      Power BI


    4. What is the status sequence that triggered alerts go through, on the Azure IoT Hub dashboard?

      Open, In-progress, Closed

      New, Closed

      New, Acknowledged, Closed

      Acknowledged, New, Closed


    5. When configuring an action, a developer has set the metric to Total device data usage, with the following settings: Operator is Greater than Aggregation type is Total Threshold value is 2000 Aggregation granularity period is 5 minutes Frequency of evaluation is Every 1 Minute When will this action trigger?

      Every one minute the action will test to see if the total data usage for the past 5 minutes exceeds 2000 bytes. If so, the action is triggered.

      Every one minute the action will test to see if the total data usage for the past 5 minutes meets or exceeds 2000 bytes. If so, the action is triggered.

      Every five minutes the action will test to see if the total data usage for the past one minute exceeds 2000 bytes. If so, the action is triggered.

      Every five minutes the action will test to see if the total data usage for the past 5 minutes exceeds 2000 bytes. If so, the action is triggered.
